item.text: In the four hundred and eightieth year after the Israelites left Egypt, in the fourth year of Solomon’s reign over Israel, during the month Ziv (the second month), he began building the Lord’s temple.
The temple King Solomon built for the Lord was 90 feet long, 30 feet wide, and 45 feet high.

The <st data-num="0197" class="">porch</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">in</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">front</st> of the <st data-num="01964" class="">main hall</st> of the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st> was <st data-num="06242 0520">30 feet</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0753" class="">long</st>, <st data-num="05921 06440">corresponding to</st> the <st data-num="07341" class="">width</st> of the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st>. It was <st data-num="06235 0520">15 feet</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="07341" class="">wide</st>, <st data-num="05921" class="">extending out from</st> the <st data-num="06440" class="">front</st> of the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st>.
He <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> <st data-num="08261 0331">framed</st> <st data-num="02474" class="">windows</st> for the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st>.

He <st data-num="01129 05921 07023 01004">built</st> an <st data-num="03326" class="">extension</st> <st data-num="05439" class="">all around</st> the <st data-num="07023" class="">walls</st> of the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple’s</st> <st data-num="05439 01964">main hall</st> and <st data-num="01687" class="">Holy Place</st> and <st data-num="06213" class="">constructed</st> <st data-num="06763" class="">side rooms</st> <st data-num="05439" class="">in it</st>.<n id="1" />

The <st data-num="08481" class="">bottom floor</st> of the <st data-num="03326" class="">extension</st> was <st data-num="02568 0520">7½ feet</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="07341" class="">wide</st>, the <st data-num="08484" class="">middle floor</st> <st data-num="08337 0520">9 feet</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="07341" class="">wide</st>, and the <st data-num="07992" class="">third floor</st> <st data-num="07651 0520">10½ feet</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="07341" class="">wide</st>. He <st data-num="05414" class="">made</st> <st data-num="03588 04052">ledges</st><n id="4" /> on the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple’s</st> <st data-num="02351" class="">outer</st> <st data-num="05439" class="">walls</st> <st data-num="01115" class="">so</st> the beams would <st data-num="01115" class="">not</st> have to be <st data-num="0270" class="">inserted</st> into the <st data-num="07023 01004">walls</st>.<n id="5" />

As the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st> was being <st data-num="01129" class="">built</st>, only <st data-num="068" class="">stones</st> <st data-num="08003" class="">shaped</st> at the <st data-num="04551" class="">quarry</st><n id="1" /> were <st data-num="01129" class="">used</st>; the sound of <st data-num="04717" class="">hammers</st>, <st data-num="01631" class="">pickaxes</st>, or <st data-num="03605" class="">any</st> other <st data-num="01270" class="">iron</st> <st data-num="03627" class="">tool</st> was <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">heard</st> at the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st> while it was being <st data-num="01129" class="">built</st>.

The <st data-num="06607" class="">entrance</st> to the <st data-num="08481" class="">bottom<n id="1" /> level</st> of <st data-num="06763" class="">side rooms</st> was <st data-num="0413" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="03233" class="">south</st> <st data-num="03802" class="">side</st> of the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple;</st> <st data-num="03883" class="">stairs</st> <st data-num="05927" class="">went up</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="08484" class="">middle floor</st> and <st data-num="04480 08484">then on up</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="07992" class="">third<n id="3" /> floor</st>.

He <st data-num="03615" class="">finished</st> <st data-num="01129" class="">building</st> the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="05603" class="">covered</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">it</st><n id="2" /> with <st data-num="01356" class="">rafters</st><n id="3" /> and <st data-num="07713" class="">boards</st> made of <st data-num="0729" class="">cedar</st>.<n id="4" />
He built an extension all around the temple; it was 7½ feet high and it was attached to the temple by cedar beams.
The Lord’s message came to Solomon:

“As for <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="01004 0834">temple</st> <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> are <st data-num="01129" class="">building</st>, <st data-num="0518" class="">if</st> you <st data-num="01980" class="">follow</st><n id="1" /> my <st data-num="02708" class="">rules</st>, <st data-num="06213" class="">observe</st><n id="2" /> my <st data-num="04941" class="">regulations</st>, and <st data-num="08104 01980">obey</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> my <st data-num="04687" class="">commandments</st>,<n id="3" /> I will <st data-num="06965" class="">fulfill</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">through</st> you the <st data-num="01697" class="">promise</st> I <st data-num="01696" class="">made</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> your <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st>.<n id="4" />
I will live among the Israelites and will not abandon my people Israel.”
So Solomon finished building the temple.

He <st data-num="01129" class="">constructed</st> the <st data-num="07023" class="">walls</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">inside</st> the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st> with <st data-num="0730" class="">cedar</st> <st data-num="06763" class="">planks</st>; he <st data-num="06823" class="">paneled</st> the <st data-num="01004" class="">inside</st> with <st data-num="06086" class="">wood</st> from the <st data-num="07172" class="">floor</st> of the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="06982" class="">rafters</st><n id="1" /> of the <st data-num="05604" class="">ceiling</st>. He <st data-num="06823" class="">covered</st> the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st> <st data-num="07172" class="">floor</st> with <st data-num="06763" class="">boards</st> made from the wood of <st data-num="01265" class="">evergreens</st>.

He <st data-num="01129" class="">built</st> a wall <st data-num="06242 0520">30 feet</st> in from the <st data-num="03411" class="">rear</st> of the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st> as a <st data-num="01004" class="">partition</st> for an <st data-num="01687" class="">inner sanctuary</st> that would be the <st data-num="06944" class="">Most</st> <st data-num="06944" class="">Holy Place</st>.<n id="1" /> He <st data-num="01129" class="">paneled</st> the wall with <st data-num="0730" class="">cedar</st> <st data-num="06763" class="">planks</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="07172" class="">floor</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="06982" class="">rafters</st>.<n id="2" />

The <st data-num="01931 01964">main hall</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">in front of</st> the <st data-num="01004" class="">inner sanctuary</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> <st data-num="0705 0520">60 feet</st> long.<n id="1" />
The inside of the temple was all cedar and was adorned with carvings of round ornaments and of flowers in bloom. Everything was cedar; no stones were visible.
He prepared the inner sanctuary inside the temple so that the ark of the covenant of the Lord could be placed there.

The <st data-num="06440 01687">inner sanctuary</st> was <st data-num="06242 0520">30 feet</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0753" class="">long</st>, <st data-num="06242 0520">30 feet</st> <st data-num="07341" class="">wide</st>, and <st data-num="06242 0520">30 feet</st> <st data-num="06967" class="">high</st>. He <st data-num="06823" class="">plated</st> it with <st data-num="02091 05462">gold</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="06823" class="">as well as</st> the <st data-num="0730" class="">cedar</st> <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st>.<n id="3" />

<st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> <st data-num="06823" class="">plated</st> the <st data-num="06441" class="">inside</st> of the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st> with <st data-num="02091 05462">gold</st>.<n id="1" /> He <st data-num="05674" class="">hung</st> <st data-num="02091" class="">golden</st> <st data-num="07572" class="">chains</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">in front of</st> the <st data-num="01687" class="">inner sanctuary</st> and <st data-num="06823" class="">plated</st> the inner sanctuary<n id="2" /> with <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>.
He plated the entire inside of the temple with gold, as well as the altar inside the inner sanctuary.
In the inner sanctuary he made two cherubim of olive wood; each stood 15 feet high.

<st data-num="0259 08145">Each</st> of the first <st data-num="03742" class="">cherub’s</st> <st data-num="03671" class="">wings</st> was <st data-num="02568 0520">7½ feet</st> long; <st data-num="07098 03671 05704 07098 03671">its entire wingspan</st> was <st data-num="06235 0520">15 feet</st>.<n id="1" />

The <st data-num="08145" class="">second</st> <st data-num="03742" class="">cherub</st> also had a wingspan of <st data-num="06235 0520">15 feet</st>; <st data-num="08147 03742">it was</st> <st data-num="0259" class="">identical</st> <st data-num="08147 03742">to the first</st> in <st data-num="04060" class="">measurements</st> and <st data-num="07095" class="">shape</st>.<n id="1" />
<st data-num="03742 0259 03651 03742 08145">Each cherub</st> stood <st data-num="06235 0520">15 feet</st> <st data-num="06967" class="">high</st>.<n id="1" />

He <st data-num="05414" class="">put</st> the <st data-num="03742" class="">cherubim</st> <st data-num="08432" class="">in</st> the <st data-num="06442" class="">inner sanctuary</st> of the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03742" class="">Their</st> <st data-num="03671" class="">wings</st> were <st data-num="06566" class="">spread out</st>. One of the <st data-num="0259" class="">first</st> cherub’s <st data-num="03671" class="">wings</st> <st data-num="05060" class="">touched</st> one <st data-num="07023" class="">wall</st> and one of the <st data-num="08145" class="">other</st> <st data-num="03742" class="">cherub’s</st> <st data-num="03671" class="">wings</st> <st data-num="05060" class="">touched</st> the <st data-num="08145" class="">opposite</st> <st data-num="07023" class="">wall</st>. The first cherub’s other <st data-num="03671" class="">wing</st> <st data-num="05060" class="">touched</st> the second cherub’s other <st data-num="0413 03671">wing</st> <st data-num="03671 0413 08432">in the middle of</st> the <st data-num="01004" class="">room</st>.<n id="2" />
He plated the cherubim with gold.
On all the walls around the temple, inside and out, he carved cherubim, palm trees, and flowers in bloom.

He <st data-num="06823" class="">plated</st> the <st data-num="07172" class="">floor</st> of the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st> with <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>, <st data-num="06441" class="">inside</st> and <st data-num="02435" class="">out</st>.<n id="1" />

He <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> <st data-num="01817" class="">doors</st> of <st data-num="08081" class="">olive</st> <st data-num="06086" class="">wood</st> at the <st data-num="06607" class="">entrance</st> to the <st data-num="01687" class="">inner sanctuary</st>; the <st data-num="0352" class="">pillar</st> on each <st data-num="04201" class="">doorpost</st> was <st data-num="02549" class="">five sided</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="05921" class="">On</st> the <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="01817" class="">doors</st> made of <st data-num="08081" class="">olive</st> <st data-num="06086" class="">wood</st> he <st data-num="07049 04734">carved</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="03742" class="">cherubim</st>, <st data-num="08561" class="">palm trees</st>, and <st data-num="06731" class="">flowers</st> <st data-num="06358" class="">in bloom</st>, and he <st data-num="06823" class="">plated</st> them with <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>.<n id="2" /> He <st data-num="07286 05921">plated</st> the <st data-num="03742" class="">cherubim</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">and</st> the <st data-num="08561" class="">palm trees</st> <st data-num="07286" class="">with hammered</st> <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>.<n id="3" />

<st data-num="03651" class="">In the same way</st> he <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> <st data-num="04201" class="">doorposts</st> of <st data-num="08081" class="">olive</st> <st data-num="06086" class="">wood</st> for the <st data-num="06607" class="">entrance</st> to the <st data-num="01964" class="">main hall</st>, only <st data-num="0854">with</st> <st data-num="07243" class="">four-sided</st> pillars.<n id="1" />

He also made<n id="1" /> <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="01817" class="">doors</st> out of <st data-num="06086" class="">wood</st> from <st data-num="01265" class="">evergreens</st>; <st data-num="01817 0259">each</st> <st data-num="01817 08145">door</st> had <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="01550" class="">folding</st> <st data-num="06763" class="">leaves</st>.<n id="2" />

He <st data-num="07049" class="">carved</st> <st data-num="03742" class="">cherubim</st>, <st data-num="08561" class="">palm trees</st>, and <st data-num="06731" class="">flowers</st> <st data-num="06358" class="">in bloom</st> and <st data-num="06823" class="">plated</st> them <st data-num="06823">with</st> <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>, <st data-num="03474" class="">leveled out</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st> the <st data-num="02707" class="">carvings</st>.
He built the inner courtyard with three rows of chiseled stones and a row of cedar beams.
In the month of Ziv in the fourth year of Solomon’s reign the foundation was laid for the Lord’s temple.
In the eleventh year, in the month of Bul (the eighth month) the temple was completed in accordance with all its specifications and blueprints. It took seven years to build.
